answers.answer: How high was your BGL? Did you fast for 12 hours before the test?

I didnt get the results, the midwife just said they were high and made an appt for me with a dr and a dietician on monday. And yes I did fast properly. ..I think eek!Im just getting myself worked up now

I wouldn't stress about it too much. Pregnancy induced diabetes is usually not permanent and goes away after pregnancy. There are things you can do to help ensure it doesn't affect your baby. Make sure you ask your doctor to explain not only what you should do but why. Having a good understanding why you have to do stuff, usually makes you stick to it, because you understand how it will effect the baby if you don't.  My sister had pregnancy induced diabetes and has two healthy, great kids!
Yea you're right. Thanks heaps xx

question: Hi ladies,I just got my glucose test results today and sugar levels are high! This is my first pregnancy and am now a bit worried!!I need any advice please.I knew my smoothe sailing of a pregnancy would come to an end!
title: Glucose test results high!
